title: Veraheim - Demographics & Racial Composition
atAGlance: **The diversity and acceptance has created an unparalleled crafting environment that produces some of the best products in the realm.** ### Why Veraheim Crafts Are Superior **Cross-Cultural Innovation**: - Dwarf stonework + Gnome magical engineering = Revolutionary designs - Human versatility + Orcish strength = New metalworking techniques - Elven elegance + Drow practical efficiency = Unique aesthetics - Halfling comfort + Tiefling artistry = Sought-after goods **No Racial Gatekeeping**: - Traditional guilds elsewhere exclude by race - Veraheim: Best craftsman wins, regardless of ancestry - Techniques shared across racial lines - Apprentices learn from ANY master, not just their own kind **The 5-Shop Challenge System**: - Forces continuous innovation - Can't rest on laurels - prove quality every 5 years - Brings out the best in every craftsman - Competition drives excellence **Collaboration Over Competition**: - Different racial specialties complement each other - A dwarf smith might partner with gnome enchanter - Workshops share space and knowledge - "Veraheim style" emerges from fusion of traditions **Economic Impact**: - Merchants from [Aelindor](/geography/aelindor-the-eternal-city) and Thornreich travel specifically to buy Veraheim goods - They hate the city's politics but can't deny the quality - Premium prices for "Made in Veraheim" items - Drives significant trade revenue beyond tunnel tolls **Famous Veraheim Products** [Examples to develop]: - Dwarf-forged, gnome-enchanted weapons - Drow silk woven with elven patterns - Halfling-made comfort goods with human practicality - Orcish metalwork with tiefling artistic flourishes ---
commonKnowledge: ### Racial Breakdown (Approximate %) Veraheim welcomes refugees and outcasts from both major powers. The racial composition reflects who needs sanctuary most: ### **Humans** (~25% / ~875 people) - Largest single group, but not overwhelming majority - Many fled [Aloria](/factions/aloria) for various reasons - Criminals seeking second chances - Political dissidents - Those who refused racial supremacy - Mixed with humans who came for opportunity - **Status in homelands**: Dominant race in Thornreich ### **Drow** (~15% / ~525 people) - Second largest group - **Only safe place** for drow to live openly - Fleeing 400 years of [Drow Persecution](/peoples/drow-persecution) - Hidden cities send people here - Secret trade networks operate through Veraheim - Grateful and loyal to Vera/Galdor - **Status in homelands**: Kill on sight in [Thelassian](/factions/thelassian), shunned by [Aloria](/factions/aloria) ### **Half-Elves** (~10% / ~350 people) - Products of forbidden relationships - Not fully accepted by either parent's culture - Often feel "between worlds" - Veraheim appeals to them - Natural diplomats and mediators in the city - **Status in homelands**: Discriminated against in both Empire and Kingdom ### **Half-Orcs** (~8% / ~280 people) - Stigmatized in human lands - Face prejudice and assumptions of violence - Come to prove themselves through contribution - Many become guards (valued for strength) - **Status in homelands**: Second-class in [Aloria](/factions/aloria), worse in [Thelassian](/factions/thelassian) ### **Orcs** (~6% / ~210 people) - Tribal societies don't fit Empire/Kingdom structures - Seen as "barbaric" by both powers - Veraheim judges them as individuals - Strong presence in crafts (smithing, building) - **Status in homelands**: Actively hostile relations with both powers ### **Other Elves** (High/Wood) (~4% / ~140 people) - Defectors from [Thelassian](/factions/thelassian) - Those who rejected elven supremacy - Outcasts who broke cultural taboos - Some came for love (married non-elves) - Smallest elf population (most stay in Empire) - **Status in homelands**: Traitors to [Aelindor](/geography/aelindor-the-eternal-city) ### **Tieflings** (~5% / ~175 people) - Demonic heritage makes them universally distrusted - Both powers fear/hate them - Veraheim: first place they're judged as individuals - Often talented in magic and trade - **Status in homelands**: Feared, persecuted, blamed for problems ### **Dwarves** (~12% / ~420 people) - Significant population (either fled their own kingdoms or never had them) - **Master craftsmen**: Dominate metalworking, stonework, engineering - Respect Veraheim's meritocracy (very dwarf-like philosophy) - Many run the most prestigious workshops in Crafter's District - Strong presence among the "5 shops per profession" elite - Could have their own cultural enclave while being integrated - **Status in homelands**: Have own mountain kingdoms? Or scattered? [TBD] - Probably helped carve/engineer parts of the city ### **Halflings** (~8% / ~280 people) - Large, thriving population - **Hospitality experts**: Run most successful inns and taverns - Natural merchants in Lower Plaza - Food culture: Bring comfort and warmth to the city - Children are everywhere, making city feel alive - Quick to make friends across racial lines - **Status in homelands**: Tolerated but second-class in both powers - Veraheim feels like home in a way nowhere else does ### **Goblins** (~2% / ~70 people) - Seen as "monsters" by both powers - Veraheim proves they can be productive citizens - Many work in service industries, maintenance - Quick, clever, adaptable - **Status in homelands**: Hunted, enslaved, or driven off ### **Dragonborn** (~2% / ~70 people) - Rare and exotic - Face suspicion (connection to dragons?) - Come seeking purpose after [The Elves-Dragon War](/history/the-elves-dragon-war) - Some serve as elite guards - **Status in homelands**: Mistrusted by both powers ### **Tabaxi** (~1.5% / ~50 people) - Wanderers and traders by nature - Come for the trade opportunities - Natural merchants and information brokers - Add exotic flair to the city - **Status in homelands**: Rare in both Empire and Kingdom ### **Halflings** (~1% / ~35 people) - Small population (generally tolerated elsewhere?) - Come for economic opportunity - Natural merchants and hospitality workers - Run many of the best inns/taverns - **Status in homelands**: Second-class but not actively persecuted ### **Gnomes** (~5% / ~175 people) - Significant technical population - **Magical engineers**: Essential for maintaining the three magical lifts - Tinkers, inventors, problem-solvers - Many work in lift maintenance and magical infrastructure - Workshops full of contraptions and experiments - Add whimsy and innovation to the city - **Status in homelands**: Dismissed as harmless or eccentric in both powers - In Veraheim: Respected for their expertise ### **Goliaths** (~1% / ~35 people) - Mountain tribes, rare in lowland cities - Come seeking purpose beyond tribal life - Make excellent guards (size and strength) - Respect Veraheim's "prove yourself" culture - **Status in homelands**: Have own mountain territories --- ### Key Observations ### **Most Persecuted Find Most Refuge** The demographics show which races face the worst treatment: - **Drow**: 18% (genocidal persecution) - **Half-breeds**: 22% combined (rejected by both sides) - **Tieflings**: 5% (feared everywhere) - **Goblins**: 3% (treated as monsters) ### **Dominant Races Are Minority** - **Humans**: 30% (vs. 100% control in Kingdom) - **Elves** (non-drow): 5% (vs. 100% control in Empire) This reversal is intentional - those with power elsewhere don't need refuge. ### **Diverse but Functional** 13 different races living together peacefully: - Common language (Common?) for communication - Shared purpose (contribution to city) - Vera's leadership transcends racial politics - Thorongil's presence prevents external aggression --- ### Racial Dynamics in Veraheim ### **No Segregation** - Housing by tier (contribution), not race - All three levels are racially mixed - Guards are diverse (though some races more common) - Workshops welcome all skilled craftspeople ### **Cultural Exchange** - Different cuisines in Lower Plaza - Various religious practices tolerated - Interracial marriages common and accepted - Children grow up seeing diversity as normal ### **Tensions** (Minimal but Present) - **Old prejudices die hard**: Some residents bring biases - **Drow-Elf relations**: Complicated given persecution history - **Human supremacists**: Some humans struggle with equality - **Cultural misunderstandings**: Different races, different customs **How Veraheim handles this**: - Zero tolerance for discrimination in housing/jobs - City Tokens can be revoked for racist behavior - Guards enforce equality strictly - Vera personally intervenes in serious cases ### **Success Stories** - **Mixed-race children**: Growing up equal, not "half-breeds" - **Cross-racial workshops**: Dwarf and Orc smiths working together - **Guard unity**: All races serving side-by-side - **Proof of concept**: 80 years without major racial violence --- ### Comparison to Homelands ### In the [Thelassian](/factions/thelassian) ([Aelindor](/geography/aelindor-the-eternal-city)): - 95%+ Elves - Other races: 5% as second-class citizens - Drow: 0% (killed on sight) - Strict hierarchy by race ### In the [Aloria](/factions/aloria) (Thornreich): - 80%+ Humans - Other races: 20% as second-class citizens - Drow: <1% (hidden, not openly acknowledged) - Human supremacy enforced ### In [Veraheim](/factions/veraheim-the-sanctuary): - No single race above 30% - 13 races represented - All treated equally under law - Meritocracy regardless of ancestry **This is why Veraheim matters**: It proves the alternative is possible. --- ### Demographics by City Level ### **Level 3 - Grand Castle** (~200 people) Mixed, but weighted toward: - Humans (Vera is human, human officials) - Drow (show of trust, senior positions) - Half-elves (natural diplomats) - Dragonborn (elite guard positions) ### **Level 1 - Mid-Level Housing** (~800 people) Most diverse level: - Successful members of all races - Merit clearly demonstrated - Mix reflects overall city demographics ### **Level 2 - Employee Housing** (~2,500 people) Largest and most diverse: - All races represented - Entry level for new citizens - Where most refugees start - Highest concentration of recently arrived --- ### Immigration Patterns ### **Steady Flow** from: - [Thelassian](/factions/thelassian): Mostly drow, some dissident elves - [Aloria](/factions/aloria): Humans, half-breeds, persecuted minorities - Islands: [When developed - other races from colonies] - Independent: Orcs, Goliaths, others from tribal lands ### **Application Process** [To be developed]: - How does one become a Veraheim citizen? - Temporary visitor → Resident → Contributor → Housing? - Evaluation period? - Who decides? --- ### Notable Racial Contributions **By profession** (stereotypes that hold true in Veraheim): **Guards**: - Half-Orcs, Orcs, Goliaths: Physical strength - Dragonborn: Elite units - All races serve, but these are common **Artisans**: - Dwarves: Master smiths, stonework - Humans: Diverse skills - Gnomes: Tinkers, magical devices **Merchants**: - Humans, Halflings, Tabaxi: Natural traders - Half-Elves: Diplomacy and negotiation **Magic/Lift Maintenance**: - Tieflings, Gnomes: Magical aptitude - Half-Elves: Inherit elven magical talent **Service**: - Halflings: Hospitality industry - Goblins: Maintenance, labor - All races in various roles --- ### The Drow Quarter? **Question**: Do drow congregate in one area, or are they integrated? **Answer** [Your decision]: - **Integrated**: Drow live throughout all three levels by merit - **Semi-concentrated**: Many choose to live near each other (comfort/community) but it's not required - **Fully integrated**: Deliberately spread to prevent "drow ghetto" formation **Recommendation**: Semi-concentrated by choice, not by rule - Shows they're free but also acknowledges 400 years of trauma - Drow community support networks - But successful drow live at all levels --- ### To Develop 1. **The Islands**: Where do other races originally come from? 2. **Languages**: Common as lingua franca? Others spoken? 3. **Cultural festivals**: Do races celebrate their own traditions? 4. **Interracial families**: How common? Fully accepted? 5. **Children**: Education system for diverse population? 6. **Religion**: Multiple gods/pantheons? How's this handled? --- ### Story Impact **Player Character Options**: All 13 races available, each with unique perspective on Veraheim **Quest Hooks**: - Racial tensions in specific situations - Characters from homelands hunting refugees - Proving Veraheim's model to outsiders - Protecting persecuted minorities - Cultural exchange and understanding **Veraheim's Message**: "Judge people by their actions, not their blood."
